content.question: Which of the following intervals is played?

choices.label: The figure presents a stack of two half notes in treble clef. The pitches are E-flat 4 and A-flat 4.
The figure presents a stack of two half notes in treble clef. The pitches are E-flat 4 and A4.
The figure presents a stack of two half notes in treble clef. The pitches are E-flat 4 and B-flat 4.
The figure presents a stack of two half notes in treble clef. The pitches are E-flat 4 and B4.

content.answer: The figure presents a stack of two half notes in treble clef. The pitches are E-flat 4 and A-flat 4.

unit.text: 2: Music Fundamentals II - Minor Scales and Key Signatures, Melody, Timbre, and Texture

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
